intro: Cheiranthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Its flowers are small, yellow or orange in color, and bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
